sense.definition: Vav, the sixth letter of the Alphabet.
sense.notes: It interchanges wit ב, as אִיסְטְבָא a. אִיסְטְוָוא, a. fr.; v. letter ב; also with ע as וָתִיק a. b. h. עָתֵק (v. וֶסֶה); v. also letter י. In inflections ו interchanges with, and is the equivalent of י. [To give ו the value of a consonant, וו is frequently used for ו, as וֶסֶת and וֶוסֶת.—For lexicographical purposes ignore the second ו in words beginning with וו.—As a vowel sign u or o (וּ, וֹ). In words of foreign derivation וּ ( u) is frequently inserted where the originals have a, as גוּלְיָיר for galearis &c.]

sense.definition: , as a numeral, six, v. א'.
, a prefix, and, but; often introducing a question: but, is it indeed so? Ḥull.
sense.notes: 2 a וכל הכל וכ' is it so that wherever הַכֹּל is used, it means &c.? Ib. והא כתיב וכ' is it not written &c.?; a. fr.
Y. Ber. III, 6 d bot. Ib. 6 a top; a. fr. V. אַבָּא II.

sense.definition: , Vav, name of the sixth letter of the Alphabet Kidd. 30 a וא"ו דגחון חציין וכ' the Vav in Ga ḥ on (Lev. XI, 42) marks the (first) half of the number of letters in the Pentateuch.
sense.notes: Ib. וא"ו … מהאי גיסא וכ' does the Vav of ga ḥ on belong to the first half or to the second?—Gen. R. s. 58 Ephron (Gen. XXXIII, 16) is spelt הסר וא"ו without Vav; a. fr.—Y. Shebu. I, 33 a bot. ושעיר וי"ו מוסיף וכ' the Vav in Us’ir (Num. XXVIII, 22) adds to the preceding subject, i.e. a goat in addition to &c. Kidd. 66 b וי"ו דשלום וכ' the Vav in Shalom (Num. XXV, 12) is curtailed (so that it may be read Shalem, unblemished). Ḥull. 16 a, v. אוּפְתָּא. B. Mets. 87 a; Meg. 16 b, v. לַבְרוּת.—Yoma 45 a, a. fr. וא"ו לא דרשי they do not use the Vav for interpretation; a. fr.— Pl. יָוִי"ם, וָוִי"ן. Y. Meg. I, 71 c top (deriving from ווי העמודים, Ex. XXVII, 10) שיהא ווים וכ' that the shape of the Vav in the Pentateuch is column-like (as in כתב אשורית); Snh. 22 a מה … אף ווים וכ' as the columns have not changed (their shape), so has not the shape of the Vav. Y. Naz. I, 51 b top עד שיזכיר ו' he must utter the Vav conjunctive. Ib. IV, beg. 53 a מאן תאנא ו' who is it that says the Vav must be uttered?; Y. Kidd. II, 62 b; a. fr.
= וַי; v. וָהּ

sense.definition: V’elleh Sh’moth ( and these are the names of), name of the second Book of Moses, Exodus.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 3; Yalk. ib. 4.

sense.definition: (ואל, cmp. b. h. יָעַל a. הוֹאִיל) propriety.
sense.notes: לא ו' it is unbecoming. Ned. 8 b לא ו' למישׁרא וכ' Ar. (ed. שרי, Var. יאי; Naḥm. יאלי) it is unbecoming (for a pupil) to absolve from a vow in a place where his teacher lives. Contr. וָלָא.

sense.definition: Vânay, name of a river or canal in Babylonia.
sense.notes: Kidd. 71 b נהר ואני Ar. (ed. יואני); Y. ib. IV, 65 d top וואניי; Y. Yeb. I, 3 b top וואניי. Gen. R. s. 16 (א)עברת נהר ו' Ar. (ed. only נהרא) at the ford of &c. [Erub. 28 b בית ואני Ms. M., v. הִינִי 3.] [‘Nahr-Avan, a canal east of the Tigris’, Neub. Géogr. p. 324.—‘Nahrvân in Irak Arabi’, Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v. ואני.]
, v. יַרְדִּינָא II
, Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII, v. בָּאיָין
, Lam. R. to I, 5, v. בִּיבֵי
, Yalk. Gen. 150, v. זוֹגָא
B. Mets. 83 b ו' שלכם cases in which you act on ascertained facts.

Ber. 33 b הַוַּ' (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) Thou, the known one!—Arakh. I, 1 זכר ו' a person distinctly male, נקבה ודאית distinctly female (no hermaphrodite &c.). Yoma VIII, 8, a. fr. אשם ו', v. אָשָׁם.—Sabb. II, 7 הו' that which undoubtedly requires the separation of the tithes, opp. דְּמַאי.—Y. Bets. I, 60 b וַודָּייוֹ, וַודָּיָיהּ where there is no doubt about it, opp. ספיקו, ספיקה. Kidd. IV, 3 (74 a) וַדָּאָן the sure cases among them.—Num. R. s. 2, end אכילה וודייה Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. ידאית) the eating (in Ex. XXIV, 1

sense.definition: emphatic form by means of He paragogic.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 3 לכה וודאית וכ' (strike out the gloss הה"א בסוף וכ') the word l’khah (Ex. III, 3) is emphatic (as if = לְךָ unto thee it belongs), if not thou &c.; Y. Succ. IV, 54 c top לך יודייה (read: לכה וו') the l’khah (Ps. LXXX, 3) has the emphatic form ( unto thee as well as unto us).—3) (noun) certainty, undisputed fact.—אין ספק מוציא מידי ו' doubt cannot take a case out of the status of certainty. Ab. Zar. 41 b הוי ספק וּוַ' ואין וכ' here is a doubt (the idolatrous character of an object may have been given up) against a certainty (that it was an idol) and the doubt cannot set aside the certainty. Pes. 9 a; a. fr.—בְּוַ', וַ' (adv.) surely, indeed; in reality. Y. Keth. V, 29 d. Gen. R. s. 98 עלית בו' ‘thou didst ascend’ thy father’s couch (Gen. XLIX, 4) means in reality (no metaphor). Ib. חללת ו' ‘thou didst defile’ (ib.) is to be taken literally. Pes. l. c. דו' מעשרי for it is sure that they separate the tithes. Gen. R. s. 55 נסה אותו בו' He tried him in the true sense of the word (gave him time); a. e.
וִידָּה, Hithpa. הִתְיַדָּה, v. יָדָה.—Denom. וִידּוּי.
, v. ודַּאי
וַדַּי, Af. אוֹדִי, v. ידי.
, Tosef. Dem. I, 27, Var. ed. Zuck., v. יירינון
, v. יָדע, יְדַע.
, Y. Bicc. III, 65 c bot., v. וַועֲדָא
pr. n. m., v. וָוא

sense.definition: (interj.; cmp. b. h. הָהּ, הֶאָח) vah ( hãvah), an exclamation of pleasure; ah! &c., contradist.
sense.notes: to וַוי (woe!). Lam. R. to I, 5 למה אמרת ווי אמר וה אמרי (Ar. וַאי) why didst thou exclaim, Vay (woe!)? Said he, I said Vah. Ib. בין וי לוה וכ' between Vay and Vah R. Joḥ. escaped.—Pesik. Asser, p. 97 b בתחלה הם אומרים וה ולבסוף הם אומרים וי at first (on entering the hot and again the cold place) they say Vah (how pleasant!), but finally they say Vay (woe!); Tanḥ. R’eh 13 הוה; Tanḥ. ed. Bub., ib. 10; Yalk. Deut. 892; (diff. versions: Y. Snh. X, 29 b bot.; Yalk. Ps. 737). Pesik. l. c. (play on הַיָּוֵן, Ps. XL, 3) ממקום שאומרים ווה וּוַי (not שאומר) from the place where they (the wicked) say Vah and (then) Vay; Tanḥ. ed. Bub. l. c.; וה וּוַיי; Tanḥ. l. c. (corr. acc.); Yalk. Deut. l. c. הי ווי; (differ. vers. in Yalk. Ps. l. c. a. Y. l. c.).
— Pl. יָוִים. Ex. R. s. 51; a. fr.
— Pl. וָוִים, וָוִין; v. וא"ו.
— Pl. וָוִין, וָוַיָּא. Targ. Ex. XXXVIII, 28. Ib. XXVII, 10; a. fr.
= וְהוּ. Y. Snh. X, 29 b top ווא"ל and he said to him.
, Tosef. Kil. III, 15 Var. ed. Zuck., v. וָורָד
אוֹחִי, אַוְוחִי, v. יְחִי.
אוֹחַר, אַוְוחַר; Pa. ווחַר, v. אֲחַר.

Shebu. 18 a עד שימות וטיב Ar. (read יָטִיבוֹ) until his gratification dies out; [Ar.: membrum virile; Hal. G’dol. אביטו, v. Perl. Et. St. p. 65].—Ed. וָטוּבֵיה Chald. form; [Rashi: וְטוּבֵיה and well is it with him, in which case it must read עד שימות הגיד ו', v. Ar. s. v. מת].
, v. sub וס.

Targ. Prov. XXIII, 29 ed. Wil. (ed. Lag. וָיָא or וַיָא). —Targ. Ps. CXX, 5; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 26 לא ישלה ווי מפומך the word woe shall never cease from thy lips. Ib. ווי דלא וכ' woe that my son does not eat &c. Ab. Zar. 11 b ו' לדין כד וכ' woe to this one (Esau), when that one (Jacob) shall rise. Meg. 16 a ויי מביתא וכ' woe from inside, woe from outside! Ib. 11 a (play on vayhi, Esth. I, 1) ויי והי הדא וכ' (Ms. M. ויי הוה מה וכ'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, a. marg. note in ed.) woe and grief, as it is written &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: the preformative וַי in the Imperfect with Vav Conversive.
sense.notes: — Pl. וַויִּן. Snh. 70 a י"ג ו' נאמרו ביין thirteen times do we read vay (woe) in the chapter about wine (Gen. IX, 20 to 24); Gen. R. s. 36. כתיב בה ו' י"ד פעמים fourteen times &c. (ib. 20 to 25).
, v. preced.

sense.definition: Vaydabber (and he spoke), name of the Fourth Book of Moses, Numbers.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 64 ספר ו'. Ib. עביד ו' תלתא וכ' divided the Book of Numbers into three books. Yalk. Gen. 4 ספר ו' (Gen. R. s. 3 בְּמִדְבַּר).

sense.definition: (יָדָה) confession of sin, prayer for pardon.
sense.notes: Tosef. Yoma V (VI), 14; Yoma 87 b מצות ו' ערב וכ' the proper time for confession (on the entrance of the Day of Atonement) is &c. Ib. וחותם בו' and closes the benediction with an allusion to confession (forgiveness). Y. ib. VI, 43 c הו' מעכב the confession (by the Highpriest, Lev. XVI, 2

sense.definition: is indispensible for the legality of the act. Snh. VI, 2 וִידּוּיוֹ his (Achan’s) confession; a. fr.— Pl. (Chald.) וִידּוּיִין, וִידּוּיִן.
sense.notes: Shebu. 14 a תרי ו' (Ms. F. שני; Rashi וִידּוּיֵי) two confessions (Lev. XVI, 6 a. 11).
, v. וַי
, v. בָּאזְיָארָן
, v. הַיְידָּא
, v, יירינון.
, v. וָותָנָא
, v. next w.

Targ. Y. Ex. XXXVI, 37.—Kel. XX, 6 ועשאו ו' (Ar. בילן) and made of it a curtain (or sail); Tosef. ib. B. Mets. XI, 8. Bets. 14 b bot. ו' טמא וכ' a door-curtain is subject to levitical uncleanness, because &c. Sabb. 138 a Erub. 102 a. Gen. R. s. 52, beg. [read:] וּוִילון מונח ביניהם with a curtain let down between them; ib. s. 74; Lev. R. s. 1; Yalk. Job 897. Esth. R. to I, 6 נגללין כו' זה וכ' they were rolled up like the curtain before the ark of the Law; a. fr.—Esp. Vilon (Curtain), the lowest of the seven heavens. Ḥag. 12 b. Ber. 58 b ו' הוא דמגלגל Ms. M. (ed. דמקרע דמגלגל, one of which is a gloss) the Curtain is rolled up (torn apart).— Pl. וִילָאוֹת. B. Bath. IV, 6 (67 b) את הו' Mish. a. Ms. M. (Bab. ed. בלניות, Y. ed. בולניות) the curtains belonging to the bath-house. Ib. 67 b בית הו' the room in which the curtains are kept. Tosef. ib. III, 1 [read:] לא את הו' ולא את המרחצאות (הויסלאות ולא את, Var. הוילסאות, being a copyist’s corrupt tautography).—Chald. pl.: וֵילָתָא. Targ. Ps. CV, 39 (not וֵילְתָא).—וֵילָוָון. Targ. Y. Ex. XXVII, 9 (ed. Amst. וִילַיָן; Y. II וָוִילְוָון, read: וִוילָוָון); ib. XXXVIII, 9 וִילֵוֵּי (corr. acc.). Ib. 12; 14 וִילַוֵן (corr. acc.). Ib. 15 וִלַוַן.—וֵילָוָתָא, constr. וֵילָוַת. Ib. XXXV, 17 וָוִילְוַת (corr. acc.). Targ. Y. Num. III, 26 וִלַוַות.
, v. preced.
= וְאִינוּן, v. יִינוּן

sense.definition: (denom. of וַי or וָהּ) woe-makers, a word coined in opposition to הוללים (merry-makers), and defined by אללי as a play on הולל־.
sense.notes: Pesik. Aḥãre, p. 170 a קרי להון ווי נייה אלו שביאין אללי וכ' (Ar. זהיינא, corr. acc.) called them (the hol’lim, Ps. LXXV, 5) vayyanaya, those who bring al’lay (woe) &c.; Lev. R. s. 17 זהוניא (corr. acc.; ib. s. 20 אלליא); Tanḥ. Aḥãre 2 זה והנייא ed. princ. (later ed. פסוק זה הוללים, corr. acc.); Tanḥ., ed. Bub., ib. 3 דהוניא; Yalk. Lev. 524 וי וייה (corr. acc.); Yalk. Ps. 811 זוהנוייא, זוהוניא (corr. acc.).
, v. ווּס sub וס.
, v. וֶושֶׁט
, v. יִילוֹן

sense.definition: (יָעַד; cmp. וַועַד) place of meeting, appointment.
sense.notes: — Pl. וִיעוּדִין. Lam. R. to II, 13; Pesik. Naḥ., p. 125 a כמה ו' ויעדתי בכם how many appointments did I arrange with you (Tabernacle, Temple &c.)!

sense.definition: Vayyikra ( and he called), name of the Third Book of Moses, Leviticus.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 3 ספר ו'; ib. s. 64; v. וַיְדַבֵּר.

sense.definition: (וָתַר) the retailer’s customary addition to exact measure.
sense.notes: Ned. 32 b; B. Bath. 57 b, a. e. אפילו ו' אסור וכ' if one forswears himself any benefit from his neighbor, he dare not even accept the customary addition &c.
, v. וְתִינְיָא
, v. וִיתָּק
, Y. Keth. IV, end, 29 b, v. וָתַר
, v. וָותָנָא

— Pl. וִיתְּקִין. Gitt. 70 a הויין ליה בנים ו' (Ar. ותוקין, וַתִּיקִין) will have sickly children; Nidd. 17 a הוין לו וכ'; Keth. 77 b ויתיקין (Asheri ויתקין; Alf. נִכְפִּין epileptic); Treat. Kallah ויתקין (some ed. וַותִּי').

sense.definition: (sub. מַכַּת or a similar w.) f. senility, debility.
sense.notes: Gitt. l. c. אחזתו ו' debility will befall him.
Gen. R. s. 98 (expl. אל תותר, Gen. XLIX, 4) אל יהי לך וִיתְּרוֹן עון שלך there will be no remnant of thy sin left (but will all be forgiven.)
, v. יָכַח, יְכַח.
, B. Bath. 98 a, v. בֵּלְשָׁפָט

sense.definition: (v. וָאלִי; P. Sm. 1062 ולא) ( it is) becoming.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXIV, 26 ו' שיפותיה וכ' Ms. (in ed. our w. omitted) it is becoming that the lips be kissed of those &c.
, v. יָלַד, יְלַד.

וְלַד m. (b. h.; יָלַד) child, infant; young of an animal; offspring; embryo. Y. Yeb. VII, 8 a וְולַד בהמת וכ' the young of a domestic animal &c., v. מְלוֹג; וו' שפחת וכ' the child of a slave &c.—Sabb. 63 b כבר נד ו' the embryo is already loosened (abortion must follow). Snh. 22 a; Sot. 2 a קודם יצירת הו' before the embryo assumes distinct shape. Lev. R. s. 14 צורות הו' the successive shapes of the embryo. Kidd. III, 12 הו' הולך אחר הזכר the child has the legal status of the father. Ib וְלָדָהּ כמותה her child has her legal status; a. fr.— Pl. וְלָדוֹת, וְולָ'; constr. וְלָדֵי. B. Kam. VIII, 2 דמי ו' damages for causing abortion. Bekh. II, 4 ולדי ו' the second generation of sheep sold on condition of dividing the young with the (gentile) seller until payment in full, v. בַּרְזֶל; a. fr.—Y. Keth. VII, 31 b bot. המקללת את וְולָדָיו בפני יולדיו who curses his (her husband’s) children in the presence of his parents; Bab. ib. 72 b יולידיו … מולידיו, v. יָלַד.—וְלַד הטומאה, v. אָב.

Targ. Gen. XI, 30; a. fr.—Sabb. 63 b איתעקר וְלָדָהּ her foetus was loosened; v. preced.— Pl. וְלָדִין. Targ. Y. II Gen. XXXII, 16; a. e.—בֵּית ולדא womb. Targ. Y. Gen. XX, 18; O. פְתַח ו'.—Targ. O. Gen. XL, 20 יום בית ו' דפ' the festival of Pharaoh’s mother

sense.definition: (preced.) a handmaid intended for breeding slave children, breeder.
sense.notes: Y. B. Kam. V, 5 a top שפחה וו' אני וכ' I sell thee a breeder.

m. (θὐάλης, Valens) Valis, an Amora, father of R. Hillel. Gitt. 59 a; Snh. 36 a (Ms. M. ולס, Ar. ed. Koh. וילס); Y. Kil. II, 32 a top; ib. I, 27 a top אלס.—Y. Ḥall. I, 57 c bot. חליס (ed. Krot. ה', read: וו'). V. Frank. M’bo p. 76. Cmp. בָּאלִי.

— Ithp. אִיתְוַוס, אִיתְוִיס, אִיתְוְוסָא to be stained, soiled. Sabb. 75 b דלִיתְוַוס בית השחיטה (Ms. M. דניתְוִיס) that the throat of the slaughtered animal be stained with blood. Ib. 124 b אִתְווּס מסנאיה טינא Ms. O. (ed. אתווסאי, Ar. ed. Koh. איתווס מאניה; ed. Sonc. אִתְוְוסֵי) his shoes were soiled with mud. Pes. 65 b; Zeb. 35 a מִיתְוְוסֵי מאנייהו their garments would be soiled (with blood). Yoma 53 a מִתְוְוסָן אסקופתא וכ' (Ms. M. 2 מִתְוְוסָא sing.) the thresholds &c.—B. Kam. 18 a דמתווס בלישא Ar. a. Ms. F. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 80, ed. דמאוס, corr. acc.) the rope was covered with dough (which attracted the chickens).

sense.definition: (יָסַת, intensive of עָשָׂה; as to ע a. (ו) י, v. Nöld.
sense.notes: Mand. Gr. p. 72) [ habitual doing, condition,]
Snh. 101 a; Keth. 110 b, a. e. שינוי ו' וכ' a change of diet is the beginning of bowel diseases.

Y. Yoma I, 38 c bot. כל וו' טובה וכ' every kind of good manners was found among them. Gen. R. s. 87 כך הי' יֶסְתָּן שׁל וכ' this was the custom of the gentiles. Ned. IX, 9 כך היא וֶוסְתּוֹ של וכ' such is that man’s way of acting.

sense.definition: regular date, or regular premonitory symptoms, of menstruation.
sense.notes: Nidd. I, 1 כל אשה שיש לה ו' every woman of regular days &c. Ib. 4 b שלא בשעת וֶסְתָּהּ out of her regular time. Ib. 11 b אשה שאיו לה ו' a woman who has no regular time. Ib. IX, 8 (63 a) שיש לה ו' that has regular symptoms of approaching menstruation, v. infra. [Ib. 12 a; 14 b שיעור ו', v. אֶוְותִּיאֹוס.] Tosef. ib. I, 11 כיוונה שעת וסתה she had her courses again (after an intermission) exactly at the usual date; Y. ib. I, 49 c top כיוונה מחמ' הווסת (corr. acc.). Ib. וו' ארוכה a delayed menstruation (which may be expected any time), contrad. to הפסק עונה a skipping over of one course; a. fr.— Pl. וֶסְתּוֹת. Ib. IX, 8 ואלו הן הו' and these are the symptoms of approaching &c. Ib. 63 a התם בו' דיומי there (ib. I, 1) regularity of date is meant, הכא בו' דגופא here regularity of symptoms. Ib. 15 a, a. e. ו' דאורייתא the rule requiring a woman to examine herself on the regular day is of biblical origin. Yeb. 64 b bot. ו' ושור וכ' the law concerning the mode of establishing a regularity of menstruation (Nidd. IX, 10) &c.—Gen. R. s. 48 (expl. עדנה, Gen. XVIII, 12), v. וֶוסְתָּנִית; a. fr.
ch. as preced. 3. Targ. Y. Lev. XV, 31 (v. Nidd. 63 b). [Lev. R. s. 28, end מטי ווסתיה, read מני מסותיה, v. מְסוּתָא.]

Taan. 9 a bot.; Zeb. 112 a Ms. R. a. K. (Ms. M. חסדא מיוסתניא, ed. חייא מיוסתינ'; perhaps identical with תוסניא, Yeb. 21 b); v. also אִסְתּוּנְיָא. [V. Neub. Géogr. p. 391; Berl. Beitr. Geogr. p. 37.]
Yalk. Gen. 82 (expl. עדנה, Gen. XVIII, 12) עדנה עדנין ו' ednah is related to iddanin (Dan. VII, 25, periods), and means a woman &c. (differ. in Gen. R. s. 48, v. וֶוסֶת).
וִיעֵד, v. יָעַד.

בֵּית ו' meeting place. Ab. I, 4 let thy house be בית ו' וכ' a meeting place for scholars.—Esp. בית ו' a) scholars’ meeting place,
college, Beth-ham-Midrash. Y. Ber. IV, 7 c bot. למחר … לבית הו' to-morrow, when I come to college &c. Y. Macc. II, 31 d bot. עושים לו בית ו' you must provide a school-house for him. Sot. IX, 15 (49 b) ב' ו' יהיה וכ' the school-house will be used for debauchery. Gen. R. s. 1; a. fr.—b) בֵּית הַוַּ' the Temple. Y. Naz. VIII, 57 a bot. שלא תנעול … מבית הו' so as not to lock out repentance from the Temple.
Ḥull. 127 a; cmp. אֲבֵידָן.
Y. Ber. II, 5 c bot. Y. Meg. I, 71 d נעביד ב' ו' let us have school; a. fr.

sense.definition: (preced. wds.) appointment, designation of time; insuspensibility.
sense.notes: Y. Yoma IV, 43 d bot. ו' שכתוב בה במועדו לית שמע מינה כלום from an appointment (of time or space) in a biblical law where the word בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ is used, we can derive nothing (for other actions). Ib. [read:] ואמר ליה רבי בון בר הייה קיים בפר משיח ו' and he said to him, R. B. bar Ḥ. applied the designation of time, i.e. the rule of insuspensibility, even to the offering of the anointed priest.
, v. וְעוֹדִי

Erub. 83 a כמה ו' how much is that ‘and something’?— Pl. וְעוֹדוֹת additions. Ib. אייתי ו' דרבי וכ' bring along the additions which Rabbi speaks of, and add them thereto. Ib. bot. בו' דרבי Ms. M. a. Rashi (ed. ועודיות של רבי, corr. acc.).

sense.definition: (denom. of preced.) with addition, large measure.
sense.notes: — Pl. וְעוֹדִיִּין. Men. VII, 2 (78 a) ששה עשרונות ו' Talm. ed. (Mish. ועדוין, read: וְעוֹדִין; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., note 9) six tenths (of an Epha), large measure.—[וְעוֹדִיּוֹת, v. preced.]
אַוְועֵי, v. יְעָא.
, Targ. Prov. VII, 20 Ms. ליומנא ו', ed. ליומא דעידא, v. עִירָא.
, Targ. Cant. II, 2 some ed., read נְעִיצָא.
, Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a bot., Or Z’rua Sabb. Nr. 57 בוקלטה, read: ומְלַקְּטָן, v. מסבסלה
, Targ. Prov. XIV, 3, v. זַקְתָּא.
Lev. R. s. 23; Cant. R. to II, 2 שושנה אחת של ו' a lily of the valley (שושנת העמקים, Cant. II, 1).

Shebi. VII, 6 הו' the rose-tree. Ib. 7 ו' חדש roses of the new crop. Y. ib. beg. 37 b עיקר הו' the rose-tree itself (the wood); Tosef. ib. V, 7 חרוב (corr. acc.). Sabb. XIV, 4 שמן ו' rose-oil; a. fr.—Y. Kil. V, end, 30 a הקנים והאגין והוו' וכ'; Tosef. ib. III, 15 והזורד ed. Zuck. (Var. והוזרד); Erub. 34 b Ms. M. והאורדין (Rashi והעוזרדין, ed. omitted; corr. acc. or plur.).— Pl. וְרָדִים, וְרָדִין. Maasr. II, 5 גינת ו' rose-garden (for the cultivation of fine fruits &c.).

sense.definition: * rose-colored, red wool, &c. Keth. 72 b טווה ו' כנגד פניה she spins red material holding it up to her face (to make it look bright; Tosaf.); [Maim.
sense.notes: : she spins in the street וּיֶ' with a rose in her hair; Rashi (who seems to read וְרָד fr. רדד): with the thread in front of her body, i.e. she spins in the street in an indecent position.]

Targ. Cant. II, 1 sq. (h. text שושנה). Targ. Ez. XXVII, 24 Ar., v. כּוּשְׁפָּא.—Y. Shebi. VII, beg. 37 b מהו לכבוש מן ההן וו' is it permitted to use roses for preserving in the Sabbatical year?—Sabb. 152 a ינקותא כלילא דו' youth is a wreath of roses. Gitt. 68 b ו' חיורא דקאי וכ' a white rose (or blossom) whose leaves are all on one side. B. Bath. 69 a, v. וַרְדָּנָא.— Pl. וְרָדִין, וַורְדֵּי. Targ. Cant. VI, 2. Ib. VII, 3.—B. Bath. 84 a דחלפא אבי וו' דג"ע (Ms. II. … אַוַּו') he (the sun) passes the rose-garden of Paradise. Ab. Zar. 65 a יתיב … בי וו' Ms. M. (ed. בוורדא) seated up to his neck in roses.

—Ḥull. 46 a bot. וסימנך כיתונא דוו' וכ' and thy sign-word (for remembering which of the two membranes of the lungs is of vital import) is, the rose-colored (precious) shirt, in which the lungs lie (i.e. the interior membrane).

sense.definition: עינוניתא דוו' the little rose-lobe, name of an additional lobe of the lungs found with animals of the steppes (יְתֵירְתָּא).
sense.notes: Ib. 47 a bot.
Gitt. 64 b (Rashi: ורדא' of Vardania, v. וַרְדִּינָא II).
, v. וַרְדִּינָא II
Ned. 81 a. Sabb. 118 b היינו ו' וכ' V. is Menahem (etymology fr. וֶורֶד).—Sifra Emor Par. 10, ch. XIII אֲוַורְדִּימָס. Y. Shebi. VIII, 38 b top אבירודימוס.
Sabb. 67 a.— Pl. וַרְדִּינֵי. B. Kam. 80 a

sense.definition: Vardina ( Vardania, Vardunia), a town in Babylonia, near Be-Berai.
sense.notes: Sot. 10 a וַארְדּוּנְיָא ed. (some ed. וַורְדּוּנֵי, Ar. וורדינא). Erub. 49 a אנשי ורדינא (Ms. M. incorr. ורדינאה, Ms. O. ורדניא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note; B. Ḥãnanel: וורדאן, v. Berl. Beitr. Geogr. p. 34, note 3) the men of V. (known for their stinginess). V. וַרְדָּאן.
Nidd. 19 b אמי ו' Ammi of V. (oth. opin. ‘handsome as a rose’; Gitt. 41 a א' שפיר נאה).

sense.definition: (וַרְדָּא), בי וו' flower-garden (v. וֶרֶד II pl.).
sense.notes: B. Bath. 69 a והוא דקרו ליה בי וו' דפ' Ms. M. (ed. לה וורדא; oth. Mss. וַורְדֵּי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) provided it goes by the name of ‘the flower garden of that man.’
, v. וַורְדִּינָא

sense.definition: (ירד, cmp. יָרִיד a. יַרְדֵּן) the large blood vessel, jugular vein (leading from the head to the heart).
sense.notes: — Pl. וְורִידִין. Ḥull. II, 1 עד שישחוט את הו' he must sever the jugular veins; Tosef. ib. II, 1.—Zeb. 25 a sq. צריך שׂיתן וו' וכ' he must let the blood of the jugular veins run into the center of the receiving bowl. Ber. 8 b; Snh. 96 a הזהרו בוו' be careful in slaughtering that you sever the veins, v. supra; a. e.

sense.definition: (אור) = חֲוַרְוָור white spots (λεύκωμα) in the eye.
sense.notes: Tosef. Bekh. IV, 2; 3 (ריר, corr. acc.); 4; (Bekh. VI, 3, Talm. ed. 38 b חורוור q. v.).
— Pl. וִורְשְׁכֵי. Kidd. 13 a. B. Mets. 51 a (Ms. R. 1 ריר'). [Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v. refers to Pers. בּרשך belt. Oth. interpret. of our w.: beads, frontlet.]

Ḥull. III, 1 נקובת הו' an animal whose gullet is found to have been perforated.—Nidd. 23 b וֶשְׁטוֹ נקוב if the infant’s gullet is perforated (there being a hole in the throat); ו' אטום if its gullet is closed; a. fr.—Yalk. Ps. 687 (translating מלקוחי, Ps. XXII, 16) לוִושְׁטִי; Midr. Till. to Ps. l. c. לויסיטי (corr. acc.; cmp. Lat. fauces) to my throat.
Ber. 8 a (Rashi: loop-hole for the rope), v. פִּיטוּרִין a. צִיפּוּרִין; M. Kat. end; Lev. R. s. 4; Tanḥ. Mikk. 10; ed. Bub. 15; Koh. R. to VI, 6.
Y. Snh. IX, 27 a top. Lev. R. s. 3; Koh. R. to VII, 19; Yalk. Koh. 976.
&c., v. יַת
Y. Snh. XI, 30 b bot. ות מר הכין and thou (the Biblical text) sayest so (that he died in the same year)? Y. Shebu. I, 33 b top; a. e.—Y. Macc. II, end, 32 a וַתְּמַר אכן (= ואת אמר).

sense.definition: (v. וָו) stork (from the shape of its beak and neck).
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CIV, 17 (ed. Lag. וָתָא, Regia ותיא). Targ. Y. II Deut. XIV, 13 (belonging to v. 18, h. text חסידה, v. אִיבּוּ).
, v. וְתִינְ'
, v. יִיתֵּק
, v. וָוְתָא
= וְאַתְיָא, v. אֲתָא
, v. וָותָנָא

sense.definition: (Βιθυνία) Bithynia, a province in the N.
sense.notes: W. of Asia Minor. Targ. Y. Gen. X, 2 וְיַתִינְ', וְיָתֶינְ' (read: וּוִית'; h. text תבל); Targ. I Chr. I, 5 (corr. acc.).—Gen. R. s. 37, beg. (misplaced, v. אוסיא); Y. Meg. I, 71 b bot. (Yoma 10 a בית אונייקי).
Y. Ab. Zar. II, end, 42 a גבינה וו', v. אוּנְיָיקִי. Ab. Zar. II, 5 Y. ed. ותיר' (corr. acc.).

vaṭikò, a. b. h. עָתֵק) enduring; trusty; strong; distinguished.—תלמיד ו' a faithful student, distinguished scholar. Y. Ber. II, 5 c; Cant. R. to VI, 2; a. fr.—Sabb. 105 a ו' נתתיך באומות (omitted in Ms. M., a. Yalk. Gen. 8

sense.definition: I made thee distinguished among the nations.— Pl. וְתִיקִים, וְתִיקִין.
sense.notes: Sifré Num. 92; ib. Deut. 13, v. כָּסַף.—Tosef. Hor. I, 1. Y. Snh. X, 29 a.—Esp. V e thikin ( Ancients), the conscientiously pious men of former days. Ber. 9 b ו' היו גומרין אותה עם וכ' (Tosef. ib. I, 2 מצותה עם וכ', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 60) the V. used to finish the reading of the Sh’mah &c.; ib. 25 b; 26 a; Y. ib. I, 3 a bot. הוו'.—R. Hash. 32 b. [וַתִּיקִין, Gitt. 70 a, v. וִיתֵּק.]

sense.definition: (v. preced.) name of a certain pastry, tart.
sense.notes: Pes. 39 b
, v. וְתִינְיָיקִי
— Pl. וָותָנַיָּא. Targ. Job XL, 17 (ed. Lag. וָותִינַ', Var. וַויְ', וַיְי').
, v. וְתִינְיָא
Y. Succ. V, 55 c (ref. to Jer. II, 13) הא וָותְרוּ לאלף (not וותרה) were they not numerous up to a thousand?; Cant. R. to I, 6 הא וותרו למאד (read: למֵאָה).

sense.definition: to do more than justice requires, to be liberal; to forego one’s rights.
sense.notes: Y. Ned. I, beg. 39 a if they had agreed על מנת לוַותֵּר to yield their rights (to allow each other the use of the entire court). B. Bath. 126 a בכור … ו' if a first-born accepted an equal share (of a field) with his brothers, he has renounced his privilege; Y. Keth. IV, end, 29 b חזקה וייתר (read: וִויתֵּר). Ib. וִיתֵּירָה (= וִיתְּרָה). B. Kam. 9 a ו' he has renounced his rights (cannot resort to his co-heirs for redress). Ruth R. to I, 8 שוִיתְּרוּ לה וכ' they relinquished their claim on her &c.; a. fr.

Y. Ḥag. I, 76 c ו' הקב"ה על וכ' the Lord overlooked Israel’s idolatry, but did not &c.; Lam. R. introd. (R. Abba 2). Y. Sot. V, end, 20 d שהיה מְוַותֵּר על קללתו he pardoned those who cursed him. Deut. R. s. 9 נְוַותֵּר לו עוד יום וכ' (not עד) let us give him a respite of one day or two.—Num. R. s. 21 לא יהא אדם מוותר על התורה man must not be more liberal than the Law; a. fr.—Snh. XI, 5 (89 a) המוו' על דברי נביא he who disobeys a prophet from mere soft-heartedness (v. I Kings XX, 35, sq.).

sense.definition: to give additional space to a plant by removing surrounding plants, to make open space.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. II, 33 d top מְוַותְּרִין בגפנים you may clear (in the Sabbatical year) between the grape vines; ib. מקום שׁנהגו לוותר וכ' where it is customary to clear before the festive month; Tosef. ib. I, 7 מְוַתְּרִין; ib. להתיר ed. Zuck. (read: לוַותֵּיר).

sense.definition: to be let loose, set free.
sense.notes: Midr. P’tirath Mosheh אֶוָּותֵר (Jellinek Beth-ham-Midrash I, 125; v. Lattes Saggio 107).
נִתְוַתֵּר (v. נָתַר)
(of bowels).

sense.definition: to be declared free, be outlawed.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to III, 4 נִתְוַתְּרוּ מעיו וכ' (Yalk. Is. 288 נתרזו בני מ') his bowels were loose that whole night. B. Kam. 50 a bot. יִתְוַותְּרוּ חייו Ms. M. (ed. יִוָּתְרוּ, Nif., v. supra) his life shall be let loose i.e. shall be outlawed; Ar. ed. Koh. יִתְיַתְּרוּן מעיו וחייו (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 26 יתותרון בני מעיו his bowels &c., v. next w.; Yalk. Ps. 648 יִוָּתְרוּ חייו his life be outlawed.

וַותֵּר l) to give a surplus, to profit, avail. Targ. Prov. X, 2.—2) to be indulgent, to overlook. Lev. R. s. 10, beg. אם אין את מְוַותֵּר ציבחר וכ' unless thou overlook something &c.; Gen. R. s. 49; a. e.

Y. Bets. II, end, 62 b מאן דאמר … יִתְיַתְּרוּן בני מעוי וכ' whoever says, the Lord is lax in dealing out justice,—may his bowels become relaxed; He is merely long-suffering &c.; Y. Shek. V, 48 d; Y. Taan. II, 65 b bot.; Midr. Till. to Ps. X, 2 לִיוַותְּרוּן מעוהי; Esth. R. to III, 15; IV, 1; Yalk. ib. 1056 יִוַּותְּרוּ מ' Yalk. Gen. 115 יִוַּתְּרוּ.

sense.definition: to be declared free, outlawed; v. preced.
(preced. wds.; also in Chald. diction) liberal, benevolent, indulgent.
sense.notes: Snh. 102 b ו' … היה was very liberal (supporting scholars). Y. Sot. V, end, 20 d (ref. to Job I,

sense.definition: ו' היה he (Job) was liberal; ומאן דלית הוא ו' וכ' but if one is not liberal, may he not be virtuous (shunning evil)?; but it means forgiving &c., v. וָתַר.
sense.notes: —Num. R. s. 9, beg. תהא ו' בתוך וכ' be lenient in thy house (be not angry when anything gets broken &c.). Y. Gitt. IV, 45 c bot. אילולי דאנא ו' if I were not lenient.—Esp. lax in the practice of justice. B. Kam. 50 a; Y. Bets. II, end, 62 b, a. fr., v. preced.— Pl. וַתְּרָנִים. Gen. R. s. 53 [read:] בביתו … ו' היו in the house of Abraham they were kind-hearted.—Fem. וַתְּרָנִית. Y. Ab. Zar. I, beg. 39 a (they said) ע"ז ו' היא the heathen deity is benevolent (entertaining the worshippers).
